byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and MARC TRACY

abstract: Yale men's basketball team, which has clinched NCAA tournament berth, finds itself at odds with many students who are protesting its continued backing for captain Jack Montague, who left university amid sexual misconduct probe; details of episode and whether Montague was found guilty remain unclear, and team has apologized for its public shows of support toward him.
lead_paragraph: The Bulldogs ended a long N.C.A.A. tournament drought, but many students are upset over the university’s support for a player who was dismissed last month without a public explanation.

headline.main: At Yale, Basketball Success Collides With Sexual Misconduct Case
headline.print_headline: Protests Overshadow a Championship at Yale

snippet: The Bulldogs ended a long N.C.A.A. tournament drought, but many students are upset over the university’s support for a player who was dismissed last month without a public explanation.
